programme.title: NHRL Teams: Robot Fighting Championship

programme.title: TSN's The Ocho
programme.desc: A collection of unusual and offbeat sports programming often geared towards the summer, named for the fictitious channel from the movie "Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story.".

programme.title: Crossnet Sand Series
programme.desc: Hitting the beach for an emerging sport with elements of four square and volleyball with a centrally-placed net and four-quadrant court. Players are eliminated as the game goes along and the winner is the first player in square four to 11 points.

programme.title: Franklin Rock River Stone Skipping Tournament
programme.desc: Objective is to see how many times the stone can bounce before it sinks.

programme.title: 2022 Noblesville Bed Races

programme.title: eSkootr Championship 2022
programme.desc: London hosts the inaugural championship of the world's first electric scooter racing series.

programme.title: U.S. Air Guitar All-Star Air-Off

programme.title: Grass Drag Racing Season Opener

programme.title: Slippery Stairs at The Ocho

programme.title: U.S. Quadball Invitational

programme.title: 2022 Pro Breaking Tour Invitational

programme.title: 2022 BullShooter Invitational Shootout
programme.desc: Top darts players take aim in Rock Hill, S.C., competing in 501 Open In/ Double Out, Split Bull, where they must win a best-of-five match, double elimination, to make it to the top four players.

programme.title: Formula One Racing

programme.title: Golden Tee World Championship
programme.desc: Masters of the classic golf video game compete for the 2019 title.

programme.title: Ultimate Tire Wrestling

programme.title: Carjitsu Championship

programme.title: Speed Chess Championship Finals

programme.title: 4 Nations Face-Off Hockey
programme.desc: Canada vs. U.S. in the championship game of the inaugural 4 Nations Face-Off featuring NHL stars. From TD Garden in Boston. Goalie Connor Hellebuyck and Team USA try to stifle Connor McDavid and Canada for a second time in six days after a 3-1 win in round-robin play. The U.S. has not won an NHL-level international tournament since the 1996 World Cup of Hockey.

programme.sub-title: 2013: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: From 2013: New York at Indiana in Game 6 of a conference semifinal series. Lance Stephenson starred for the Pacers in a seven-point win over Carmelo Anthony and New York that put them into the conference finals for the first time since 2004.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2013: Indiana at Miami in Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2013: Miami at Indiana in Game 6 of the Eastern Conference finals.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1988: Atlanta at Boston in Game 7 of the Eastern Conference semifinals. Dominique Wilkins scored 47 points for Atlanta, but the Celtics prevailed 118-116 thanks to Larry Bird's 20 fourth-quarter points.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1988: Detroit Pistons at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: From 1988: Detroit at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 6 of the NBA Finals. The Lakers won a close one 103-102 to force Game 7.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1988: Detroit Pistons at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: From 1988: Detroit at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 7 of the NBA Finals.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1989: Chicago at Cleveland in Game 5 of a first-round playoff series. Michael Jordan's buzzer-beater gave Chicago a 101-100 win.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.sub-title: 2025: Los Angeles Clippers at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Golden State Warriors. From Sun. April 13, 2025.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. The visitors have won four of five games in this series as New York takes a 3-2 edge back to Motown, where the Pistons have lost an NBA record-tying nine straight playoff games. Third-year center Jalen Duren had nine points, 14 boards and six assists in Detroit's 106-103 Game 5 win.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Madison Square Garden. New York's series lead is down to 2-1 after a 115-93 loss in Game 3 that drops the Knicks to 1-3 at home this postseason. Boston led wire-to-wire and shot a sizzling 50 percent from beyond the arc, with all five starters sinking a three, plus five from Payton Pritchard (23 points).

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. The Knicks are one win away from their first conference final in a quarter century after fending off Boston 121-113 in Game 4 behind Jalen Brunson's 39 points and 12 assists. Celtics star Jayson Tatum left with a leg injury in the final minutes after pouring in 42 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Boston Celtics at New York Knicks in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Madison Square Garden. Down 3-2, reigning-champion Boston won't go quietly despite losing star forward Jayson Tatum to injury. Jaylen Brown, Derrick White (60 points combined) and reserve center Luke Kornet starred in a 127-102 Game 5 win, delaying New York's bid for its first Eastern final in 25 years.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Now wearing Lakers gold, Luke Doncic tries to oust Anthony Edwards and Minnesota for a second straight postseason after willing Dallas to a 4-1 win in the 2024 West finals. Twenty years earlier was the T-Wolves' last playoff meeting with the Lakers, a 4-2 West finals loss.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Anthony Edwards and the T-Wolves try to replicate their fine form from a 117-95 win in Game 1, the Lakers' first at home since 2012. Minnesota shot 21-for-42 from long range, including six threes from Naz Reid. Newest Laker Luka Doncic tallied 37 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 3 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Luka Doncic (31 points, 12 boards, 9 assists) and the Lakers clawed past the T-Wolves 94-85 in Game 2 to send the series north tied 1-1. This is the same court where Doncic (with Dallas) ended Minnesota's season last May with three road wins in the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Chris Finch's T-Wolves have a 2-1 series edge after a spirited 13-1 closing run to take Game 3, 116-104. Fifth-year forward Jaden McDaniels scored a career playoff-high 30 points and helped clamp down on L.A.'s Luka Doncic. LeBron James tallied 38 in a losing effort.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2013: San Antonio Spurs at Miami Heat
programme.desc: From 2013: San Antonio at Miami in Game 7 of the Finals. LeBron James and the Heat closed out the stubborn Spurs to claim a second consecutive crown. James capped another MVP performance with 37 points and 12 rebounds.

programme.title: Vince Carter: The Interview
programme.desc: Eight-time NBA All-Star and dunk icon Vince Carter sits down with host Steve Smith, discussing his Toronto Raptors days, his 2000 Slam Dunk victory and more.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1994: New York Knicks at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: From 1994: New York at Houston in Game 7 of the Finals. The Rockets captured their first NBA title with a 90-84 win. Hakeem Olajuwon paced Houston with 25 points.

programme.desc: From 1989: Detroit at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 4 of the Finals. The Pistons beat L.A. 105-97 to sweep the series. Joe Dumars was named the Finals' MVP.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1987: Boston Celtics at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: From 1987: Boston at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 6 of the Finals. Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and series MVP Magic Johnson lifted L.A. to its fourth title in eight years with a 106-93 triumph. Dennis Johnson tallied a game-high 33 points in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Minnesota Timberwolves at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 2 of the Western Conference finals. From Paycom Center. The Wolves' postseason road prowess (10-3 last two years) hit a speed bump with a 114-88 loss in Game 1 after leading by four at the half. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tallied 31 points and nine assists, while Jalen Williams added 19 with five steals. The OKC bench shot 8-of-11 from distance.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Oklahoma City Thunder at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 4 of the Western Conference finals. From Target Center. The T-Wolves trail the series 2-1 but look to ride the momentum from a 143-101 Game 3 drubbing of OKC sparked by stars Anthony Edwards (30 points in 30 min.) and Julius Randle (24 pts.). The Thunder are 3-3 on the road this postseason, with no winning margin of more than six points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 5 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. J.J. Redick's Lakers come home staring at elimination after a 116-113 T-Wolves win in Game 4 behind Anthony Edwards' 43 points and clutch late play from Jaden McDaniels. LeBron James scored 27, but none in the fourth quarter, which Minnesota has controlled in the series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies in Game 3 of a Western Conference first-round series. From FedExForum. The Grizzlies return to Tennessee singin' the blues after an empty two-game trip to OKC in which the Thunder never trailed after the opening minutes of Game 1. Mark Daigneault's top-seeded squad committed just seven turnovers in Game 2 and had 16 steals/blocks to eight for Memphis.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From FedExForum. Top-seeded OKC survived a 29-point deficit in Game 3 en route to a 114-108 victory and a 3-0 series lead. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 and Jalen Williams added 26, including the go-ahead free throw that game the Thunder their first lead with 1:20 to play. Scottie Pippen tallied 28 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. Kenny Atkinson's top-seeded Cavs get back to action after sweeping their first-round series by an average of 30.5 points, with star guard Donovan Mitchell sharing the spotlight with Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton. Cleveland took the teams' last two playoff meetings in 2017 and 2018 (1st Rd.).

programme.sub-title: Game 5: Minnesota Timberwolves at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 5 of the Western Conference Finals. From Paycom Center. Up 3-1, the Thunder look to seal their first trip to the NBA Finals since 2012 after holding off Minnesota 128-126 in Game 4 behind league MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's playoff career-high 40 points. OKC corralled 14 steals, contributing to the Timberwolves' 21 turnovers in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks in Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals. From Madison Square Garden. The Knicks' first conference finals in 25 years is also their fourth in a row against Indiana, which won that 2000 series after falling in 1994 and '99. More recently, Tyrese Haliburton and the Pacers fought off the Jalen Brunson-led Knicks in seven games in the Eastern semifinals last spring after dropping the first two games at MSG.

programme.sub-title: Game 2: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks in Game 2 of the Eastern Conference finals. From Madison Square Garden. New York trails 1-0 after squandering the opener in overtime to a relentless Pacers squad headlined by hot-shooting Aaron Nesmith (eight threes, 30 points). Indiana erased a 14-point deficit in the final three minutes of regulation and had a 27-4 edge in points off turnovers. The Knicks are 3-4 at MSG this postseason.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference finals. Rick Carlisle's Pacers come home on Indy 500 Day looking to pull away from the Knicks after grinding out wins in the first two games in New York City. Ninth-year forward Pascal Siakam exploded for 39 points in Game 2, while Jalen Brunson's 39.5 ppg and eight assists/game have not been enough for the Knicks, who now look to build on their 5-1 road record this postseason.
